intro: Curculigo savantwadiensis, commonly known as the Savantwadi arrowhead, is a flowering plant native to the Western Ghats of India. It belongs to the family Orchidaceae, which includes orchids, and is characterized by its distinctive arrowhead-shaped leaves. The plant produces small, greenish-yellow flowers that are clustered in loose inflorescences. It thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often found in tropical and subtropical regions. Due to its unique morphology and habitat, it is of interest to botanists and conservationists.
